algorithm_technique: Graph traversal, QuickSelect for efficient k-largest neighbor selection
problem_summary_simple: Find the maximum sum of a star graph (center + neighbors) with at most k edges.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate through each node as a potential center, collect positive neighbors, and use QuickSelect to find the k largest neighbor values for maximum star sum.
key_insights: The problem can be solved by considering each node as a potential center of the star graph.
Only positive-valued neighbors contribute to increasing the star sum, so filter them.
QuickSelect is crucial for efficiently finding the top k neighbors without full sorting.
